title: Congress Considers Sidestepping Debate Over Border-Wall Funding
text:
WASHINGTON—As disagreements about funding for a border wall again begin to consume spending talks in Congress, lawmakers are exploring an option to mitigate the controversy: putting it off until next year.

Officials on Capitol Hill crafting spending legislation are considering extending current funding for the Department of Homeland Security—which oversees construction of the wall—for another year, according to several people familiar with the deliberations.
